title: Website Designer and Developer for Warrior Angels
job_description:
Warrior Angels, a premium activewear brand Based in California, is looking for an experienced Website Designer and Developer to create our official website from the ground up. This role involves both the design and development of a fully functional, visually appealing, and user-friendly e-commerce platform, with ongoing quarterly maintenance and updates.

Responsibilities
 • Design Phase
 • Develop a visually compelling and brand-aligned website design.
 • Ensure responsive and intuitive design for desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms.
 • Incorporate dynamic product pages, multimedia content, and engaging layouts.
 • Development Phase
 • Build a fully functional e-commerce website with secure payment gateways, inventory management, and customer support tools.
 • Optimize the site for fast load times and search engine visibility (SEO).
 • Integrate analytics tools to monitor site performance and user behavior.
 • Content Integration
 • Add essential sections such as “About Us,” blog, lookbooks, and product showcases.
 • Ensure seamless social media and newsletter sign-up integrations.
 • Maintenance
 • Provide quarterly maintenance, including updates, bug fixes, and performance optimizations.
 • Propose enhancements based on analytics and feedback.

Requirements
 • Proven experience in designing and developing e-commerce websites (preferably for fashion or lifestyle brands).
 • Expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and e-commerce platforms like Shopify, WooCommerce, or custom solutions.
 • Familiarity with UX/UI principles and SEO best practices.
 • Strong understanding of website analytics and optimization.
 • Ability to deliver projects on time and provide ongoing support.

Quote Request

Please include a rough quote for:
 1. Designing and building the website (one-time cost).
 2. Quarterly maintenance fees (ongoing).

If interested, please share your portfolio, estimated timeline, and a rough quote. We look forward to collaborating with a professional who shares our passion for creating a unique, engaging online experience for Warrior Angels! less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
I'm excited about the opportunity to create a distinctive e-commerce presence for Warrior Angels. With over 15 years of experience designing and developing premium brand websites, including several successful activewear and lifestyle brands, I understand the unique challenges and opportunities in creating a compelling online shopping experience that reflects your brand's ethos.

My approach combines strategic UX design with robust technical implementation, ensuring both visual appeal and operational excellence. I particularly appreciate your focus on analytics and ongoing optimization, as this aligns perfectly with my data-driven methodology for e-commerce success.

title: Build a Web App that allows users to coordinate social get-togethers through posts and with chat
job_description:
Description:
We are building an MVP for a platform that allows users to organize and join real-life gatherings. The platform will include user profiles, interest-based event matching, payment processing, and geolocation. We are seeking an experienced WordPress developer to set up and customize this functionality using existing plugins and customizations where needed.

Scope of Work:

1. User Profiles:

Configure user registration, login, and profiles using Ultimate Member or a similar plugin.

Add custom fields for user interests and bios.



2. Event Management:

Set up event creation and management with The Events Calendar or Modern Events Calendar.

Allow front-end event submissions and RSVPs.



3. Payments:

Integrate WooCommerce with Stripe or PayPal to collect fees from event organizers.



4. Search and Filtering:

Implement interest-based event search using FacetWP or another plugin.

Add geolocation-based filtering with GeoDirectory and Google Maps API.



5. Customization:

Create a dashboard for users to manage their events and RSVPs.

Customize front-end pages using Elementor Pro or custom CSS.




Requirements:

Proven experience with WordPress and relevant plugins (e.g., The Events Calendar, Ultimate Member, WooCommerce).

Strong skills in HTML, CSS, PHP, and JavaScript.

Familiarity with integrating payment gateways like Stripe or PayPal.

Experience with geolocation APIs (Google Maps).

Bonus: Ability to optimize performance and ensure scalability.


Deliverables:

Fully functional MVP deployed on our hosting platform.

Documentation for all customizations and plugin configurations. less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
I understand you're looking to build an events-focused MVP using WordPress, combining user profiles, event management, payments, and location-based features. Having architected similar community platforms for clients like Warner Brothers and Turner, I can help ensure your platform is both user-friendly and scalable.

My experience includes extensive work with WordPress ecosystems, particularly The Events Calendar, Ultimate Member, and WooCommerce. I've implemented several geolocation-based platforms and have deep expertise in payment gateway integrations, including Stripe and PayPal.

What sets me apart is my focus on performance optimization and user experience. I'll ensure your MVP not only meets functional requirements but is also built with scalability in mind, using best practices for plugin integration and custom development where needed.

I'd love to discuss your vision in more detail and share some specific recommendations for your platform architecture.

Thanks,
-Aaron

title: Web Designer and Developer: Children's Book
job_description:
About the book

Summary
A mysterious balloon with multiple faded colors approaches Bajette as she is in a luncheonette, sad about her lost cat. Her, the balloon, and a friend, Bobby she meets along the way, go on an adventure that lands them in front of people that can use a smile. Generosity is her superpower. What will she gift from her backpack? Will the balloon stay alive? Will Rocco the cat be found?.....that’s the adventure and magic of smiles! We have some in store for you too!

Elements of the book
The mood balloon is the center of the design scheme, and there is no flexibility in changing that or the “smiles for gifting” stickers.

The book has personality and many positive messages for children that bring awareness to disability, love/aging, allergies, and the environment/community and safety. The main drive and goal of this book is to teach children about generosity. 

There is a lot of opportunity to engage children, parents and teachers. 

The stickers that will be gifted will be available to copies I order and will be available upon request. There will be a page in the book that will offer that since the stickers can’t be available through some POD companies. This will be a standout page and not just an afterthought. 

The sticker will be a traditional “yellow” smiley sticker but it won’t be yellow, it will have the colors of the original balloon.


Project Scope
Logo 
A logo exists. Will need font and logos created with and without book name.


Web Design and Development
Content: Interactive Map with my travels, about the author, about the book, sticker request, to buy the bookbook, future e-commerce for other products
Add a publicity page to the web content to include: social media highlights, press, photos of my travels and classroom readings.
Add a page of stories. This would be to highlight how kids gift the smile stickers. There will be something for parents and/or teachers to write in. That will be an ongoing promotion for active engagement.
Build an SEO site
Build a secure site
The POD for the book would be through Lulu to be integrated on my site
Build v1 now with scalability and elasticity for v2 which will include heavier e-commerce with other POD and direct commerce products and merchandise and an interactive map.
Other interactive engagement features could also be a possibility in v2 or beyond. 

Requirements
Web design and development experience with modern platforms: Squarespace, Wix, Shopify etc.. 
Will need to present the best web platform option for my project and future needs.
Modern and absolutely beautiful, welcoming, engaging UI.
Extensive experience with building sites with a strong UX.
Building sites with integrations with POD companies and other e-commerce platforms and components
Must have SEO experience and provide SEO guidance unique to me.
Building sites that are easy for someone without experience to edit
Building sites with elasticity for future growth
Must have an impressive portfolio with brands that have personality.
Should be brand-minded.

Budget: $500-$1000 (depending on experience) less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
Hi! I'm excited about the opportunity to help bring "The Mood Balloon" to life online. As someone who has worked extensively with authors and publishers (including projects for Warner Brothers and the New York Times), I understand the unique challenges of creating an engaging digital presence for children's literature that serves multiple audiences - young readers, parents, and educators alike.
Your focus on scalability, from initial POD integration to future e-commerce expansion, aligns perfectly with my experience building flexible, growth-ready platforms. I've successfully launched similar multi-phase projects that started focused and grew organically with their audience.
I'll craft a solution that not only meets your immediate needs but positions you for future success through:

A welcoming, kid-friendly interface that maintains professional appeal
Seamless POD integration with robust e-commerce capabilities
Engaging interactive elements that support your message of generosity
Easy content management for ongoing updates
Strong SEO foundation for visibility

Would you be open to a quick call to discuss platform options and how we can best showcase your message of generosity?
Thanks,
-Aaron

title: Content Managers for HTML to Drupal Site Migration
job_description:
We are looking for experienced CMS Content Migration Specialists to assist with the migration of our website to Drupal 10. This role involves creating pages in Drupal by using pre-built components and copying content and assets from the live site and code-repositories, ensuring that all content is accurately transferred and structured within the new CMS.

Primary Availability Requirement:
This role requires availability between December 16th and January 17th as this period is critical to our migration timeline.

Key Responsibilities:
- Recreate pages in Drupal by copying text, images, videos, and other assets from the live site and HTML in code-repositories.
- Use pre-built Drupal components to structure content in line with the website’s design and functionality.
- Ensure that all migrated content adheres to design and formatting standards, maintaining consistency across devices and platforms.
- Review how the current pages handle responsiveness and replicate that behavior within the CMS to ensure consistent user experience across devices.
- Collaborate with the development and QA teams to address any issues related to the migration.
- Report and document any discrepancies or issues encountered during the migration process in Jira.

Requirements:
- Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently while following project guidelines
- Strong experience with content migration projects, preferably into Drupal 10
- Attention to detail and the ability to ensure content matches the original site
- Familiarity with Drupal 10 page building using components
- Availability for daily standups and progress updates
- Familiarity with Jira for task management and tracking

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience with large-scale website migrations
- Strong understanding of content structuring in a CMS environment, particularly Drupal

Communication:
- We hold a daily 15-minute standup to discuss work progress and any blockers. Attendance during these standups is required and billable
- We prefer written communication with our standup being the exception. This allows for asynchronous communication and makes it easier to share knowledge across time zones and work schedules
- The primary platform for tracking and managing tasks is Jira - All work progress, assignments, and updates will be communicated through Jira
- For conversations related to availability, meetings, and quick discussions, we use Microsoft Teams

Timeline:
You'll work 30 hours per week or more for 4-6 weeks, starting as early as December 1. If you're interested in committing to more than 40 hours per week, you are welcome to do so, which could help us reach project milestones sooner.

Location: 
- US, CA, UK, EU, IN, TW

If you are a detail-oriented content migration specialist with experience in website migrations and you're ready to help us transition our website to Drupal, we would love to hear from you. Apply now! less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
Hi there,
I noticed your need for a content migration specialist and wanted to share my experience leading large-scale CMS migrations. While I have extensive experience with various CMS platforms including WordPress, Craft, and custom solutions, I should note upfront that I would only be interested in this project if there's flexibility regarding the target CMS platform. I have some concerns about Drupal 10's long-term maintainability and would be happy to discuss alternative solutions that might better serve your needs.
My background includes migrations for major media properties like Uproxx and World Star Hip Hop, where I managed content transfers involving hundreds of thousands of pages while maintaining SEO value and user experience. I'm comfortable with component-based architectures and ensuring responsive design integrity across platforms.
I'm available for your required timeline (Dec 16 - Jan 17) and can commit to 30-40 hours per week. I'm also well-versed in enterprise project management tools like Jira and comfortable with your proposed communication structure.
Thanks,
-Aaron

title: Freelance WordPress and HubSpot Developer Needed for Short-Term Backup Support
job_description:
We are seeking an experienced freelance developer to provide backup support for our WordPress and HubSpot websites during the holiday season. This is a short-term, part-time role with the potential for future collaboration based on performance. You will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and ensuring the smooth operation of our Wordpress and HubSpot websites while our primary developer is on vacation.

Responsibilities:

WordPress:
- Manage and maintain WordPress website, including updates to themes, plugins, and core.
- Troubleshoot and resolve website errors (e.g., page loading issues, plugin conflicts).
- Perform minor website updates as needed (e.g., updating content, creating new pages).

HubSpot:
- Manage and troubleshoot website issues that may arise, including content updates through HubDB and HubSpot CMS.
- Update and optimize HubSpot forms, email templates, and landing pages.
- Address any issues related to HubSpot redirects or basic native HubSpot integrations.

General:
- Respond promptly to urgent issues, ensuring minimal downtime.
- Communicate regularly with our team on task progress and status updates.

Requirements:

- Proven experience with both WordPress and HubSpot development.
- Strong understanding of:
- WordPress: Custom themes, plugins, Elementor (or other page builders), and troubleshooting.
- HubSpot: HubSpot CMS, HubDB, native integrations and forms.
- Ability to diagnose and fix technical issues efficiently and independently.
- Availability to respond to emergencies within 24 hours.
- Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Familiarity with hosting environments (e.g., cPanel, LiquidWeb).
- Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, HubSpot CMS and HubDB.

Commitment:
- Duration: 3–4 weeks (December 12 through January 2).
- Hours: Approximately 5–10 hours per week between Dec. 12 and 24, 0-5 hours per week from Dec. 25-Jan.2, with flexibility for emergency coverage.
- Availability: Must be reachable by phone from 8:30am - 5:30pm Monday - Friday for urgent requests except on Dec. 25 and Jan. 1 - which no coverage will be required.

How to Apply:
Please submit the following:
- A brief introduction, including relevant experience with WordPress and HubSpot.
- Examples of similar projects or a portfolio showcasing your work.
- Your availability during the holiday period and hourly rate.
- A reference or testimonial from a past client (if available).

Additional Information:
This is a remote, freelance role. We will provide access credentials (securely via LastPass), and a quick onboarding session before the start date. less

Our current medical scheduling system is difficult to navigate, particularly on mobile devices, so we need a seamless way to view and manage appointments on an alternative platform.

Responsibilities:

 • Analyze the current medical scheduling system to identify and extract relevant data.
 • Develop a bot/tool to scrape scheduling information and export it to the new platform.
 • Ensure the data syncs in real-time (or near real-time) between both platforms.
 • Implement features to handle conflicts or data discrepancies during syncing.
 • Provide user-friendly tools or documentation for ongoing management and troubleshooting.

Requirements:

 • Proven experience in web scraping, automation, or bot development.
 • Familiarity with medical scheduling systems (preferred, but not required).
 • Strong understanding of APIs and integration between systems.
 • Ability to ensure data security and compliance with HIPAA (if applicable).
 • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Deliverables:

 • A fully functional bot/tool that syncs scheduling data between systems.
 • Documentation and training on how to use and maintain the tool.
 • Ongoing support for any bugs or improvements during the initial rollout period.

Preferred Skills:

 • Experience with healthcare or medical software systems.
 • Knowledge of scheduling platforms and their APIs.
 • Ability to design user-friendly interfaces for mobile devices. less

title: Teach me how to receive a served volleyball
job_description: I need an experienced coach/teacher in the Austin, Texas area to teach me how to receive a served volleyball. When I receive, the ball usually flies out of bounds to the left or right.
cover_letter:
As fate would have it, you've reached a non-volleyball-playing individual who doesn't even live in Austin, Texas, willing to give advice on receiving a served volleyball. So here I am, armed with an internet connection and a desire to help, offering you some tips to improve your reception skills. While I may not have firsthand experience, I've done my research to provide you with useful pointers. You should probably check out local volleyball clubs rather than upwork, I doubt you'll find anyone here that will meet your needs.

But, here are some key pointers to consider when receiving a served volleyball:

Proper stance: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly staggered, with your knees bent and your weight on the balls of your feet. This allows you to react quickly and move in any direction as needed.

Platform technique: To create a solid platform, extend your arms out in front of you and clasp your hands together by interlocking your thumbs and keeping your palms flat. Your elbows should be straight, and your hands should be positioned about waist level.

Ball tracking and positioning: Keep your eyes on the ball as it approaches you. Position yourself so that the ball will contact the middle of your forearms, ideally between your wrists and elbows. Make sure your platform is angled slightly upward, which will help direct the ball towards your target.

Absorb and redirect: As the ball makes contact with your forearms, use your legs to absorb the impact by bending your knees slightly. This will help control the ball's trajectory. At the same time, redirect the ball towards your target by angling your platform in the desired direction. Remember not to swing your arms or use your wrists, as this can cause the ball to go out of bounds.

Follow-through: After making contact with the ball, continue to move your platform in the direction of your target. This follow-through helps ensure the ball goes where you intend it to.

In conclusion, while I may not be the ideal volleyball guru you were seeking, I hope these tips have provided you with a starting point to up your game. Remember, practice makes perfect, so keep at it and, who knows, you might just become a volleyball legend! Wishing you all the best in your journey towards volleyball mastery. May your serves be powerful, your receptions be accurate, and your opponents be forever in awe of your newfound skills!

Best,
-Aaron

title: Convert Existing Website to Wordpress
job_description: I am looking for an experienced web developer / web designer to take an existing website created on square space and build a new site with the current content onto a wordpress theme. Will provide an inspirational website for an overall look and feel the client is looking for.
cover_letter:
Hi, just came across your post and was hoping to have the opportunity to suggest you don't move to wordpress. I am sure you will find a ton of people willing to put together a site for you, and wordpress can be a decent platform with the right developer. However, typically (especially nowadays with everyone and their uncle trying to find their "side hustle") it is almost impossible to find a good and qualified developer that won't take your money and leave you with something that I will end up being called on to fix.
I don't want to waste more of your time, suffice to say I would recommend you take a look at https://craftcms.com. It is a design first CMS I have used for many years, having moved countless clients away from broken or hacked wordpress sites, as well as from wix, squarespace, drupal, you name it. The cost to build is similar, usability is sooooo much better, and it doesn't have the toxic ecosystem of developers all fighting for the opportunity to scrap together a crappy wordpress site.
Some of the sites I built in the last year using craft:
https://plainfancycabinetry.com/
https://thepaleodiet.com/
https://www.pefinfo.com/
https://www.supplyit.com/

cover_letter:
Hey man, took a look at your loom and I'm really surprised you are using webflow to manage your knowledge-base. I understand the gui is super useful, but i took a look at your actual site and you have a ton of information there. Additionally the webflow api is not as intuitive, especially not at this scale while you are defining your own schema (using a speadsheet) anyway. 
If you need a hand fixing the few things you have I would be happy to (you also have some layout bugs, where things are overlapping etc) BUT I would also highly recommend you consider taking this off of webflow and get into a system you can have more control over the actual data, especially since a site like this probably wont require significant design alterations (which is where webflow is really strong). Not trying to be critical, i am sure you have your reasons for using webflow, in my experience it is very weak managing stuff like this without constant headaches.
I would recommend Craft CMS, its headless by design and has graphql built in, which could be really helpful if you are ever trying to access this knowledge-base from with your standalone apps.

title: WordPress Developer to Redo Site (Ongoing Work)
job_description:
We are looking for a talented web developer with a design background to redesign and upgrade our website, Copiana.com, with custom HTML and CSS. This should be easy to navigate for our internal team, as we are constantly adding photos, new team members, and blogs to the site. Our team will provide the branding outlines, copy, photos, wireframes, and anything else you might need. 

The website overhaul is a fixed price, but please include your hourly rate as well. We are looking for a developer to maintain and freshen the site for potentially 4-6 hours per month. We are very passionate about keeping the lines of communication open, so if you are working with a team, we want to meet them and communicate directly with them. 

Phase One:
Work with the Copiana marketing team to outline goals for copiana.com
Determine any upgrades/WordPress plugins needed to optimize speed, design, and efficiency. (Think GoDaddy, WordPress helpdesk, etc.)
Develop and finalize design layout of the wireframes and edit proofs with the Copiana team

Phase Two:
Set up a staging area, and develop the website
Once a page is finished, send it to the marketing team for feedback.

Phase Three:
Launch website 
Maintain and update the website on an hourly basis


Priorities:
Speed
Cutting edge design
Microinteractions specifically
SEO optimization
Easy navigation/editing for the internal marketing team


Plugins we will use:
Google Analytics
Zoho Forms
Yoast SEO
404 Error Redirect 
Vimeo (maybe youtube)
CTA Plugin

What is Copiana?
Copiana brings aeroponic tower farms to commercial spaces. We are working to build healthier communities by reconnecting urban tenants to where their food comes from. We began introducing our aeroponic towers to commercial properties in 2018, and we have seen the benefit that a fresh, local source of produce has on urban environments.

Our team develops, maintains, harvests, and manages your farm—and hosts monthly harvest events. Each harvest becomes a wellness event. Think of it as an on-site, tower-to-table farmers market that you don’t have to coordinate. 

While a traditional farm or garden may not be feasible, Copiana makes incorporating an aeroponic farm easy and maintenance-free. Our space-saving farms can grow indoors or outdoors year-round. The plants we grow don’t undergo any of the stressors of traditional farming (weather, pests, disease), which means our produce reaches its full nutritional potential. less

title: Wordpress Website Refresh
job_description:
The Learning Technology Center is seeking a web design/developer or team to refresh our website (ltcillinois.org). The is a multi-phase project that involves three websites, installing and customizing a pre-purchased Wordpress theme, customizing and styling 7+ external Wordpress plugins, and customizing/designing 65-80 Wordpress pages to take full advantage of the Theme’s features. 

Preference is given to designers or firms with the following experience:
- Experience customizing the plugins mentioned in the description.
- Experience creating custom-post-types and using Advanced Custom Fields

PHASE 1

// WordPress Theme
We have already purchased a Wordpress Theme (Essentials). After using a custom-designed theme for our last redesign and experiencing many technical issues, we feel more comfortable using a widely supported theme and customizing it to our needs. However, we’re also open to other designs or themes as well.

The site currently uses WP Bakery for page layouts. We would like to switch to Elemantor with the new launch. 

// Customization of Theme
The customization of the theme is critical to the success of the website. This will include basic customization options in the theme.

Custom Post-Types include: 
Networks
Certifications
Online Courses
Learning Resource Library
People
Speaker’s Bureau

// Integration and Customization of Plugins
We use several plugins that provide end-user functionality will need to be themed or adjusted to match the style of the new website. Plugins include: 

The Event Calendar Pro. Customization of CSS and php files are needed to achieve desired appearance and functionality. The php customization already exists and can be copied to the new site. 

Events Schedule WP Plugin. Add CSS so the schedule matches the website appearance. Modifications to PHP might be needed.

WP Grid Builder. Add CSS and change configuration so that grids match the design of the site. This is the plugin we use to display most of our custom post-types. 

Formidable Forms Pro. Add CSS so the forms match the website appearance. 

GTranslate. Not sure what integration is necessary, and we’re open to using a different plugin as long as it can stylistically fit with the site.

Recent Posts Widget Extended. Not sure what integration is necessary, and we’re open to using a different plugin to add engagement on blogs. 

Admin White Label Login. We can use a different login page, but the login needs to be match the theme. 

// Design of All Pages. 
In addition to design customization, the design will need to review each page and make layout/design adjustments. We currently have 66 pages and 92 posts. 

PHASE 2

During Phase 2, we intend to merge two additional websites with our main website. Design specs will be worked on prior to this stage. 

Websites to merge: 
Il-edtech.org becomes ietc.ltcillinois.org
Iltpp.org becomes iltpp.ltcillinois.org

PHASE 3 (Optional)

Lead the design integration of multiple platforms, including Higher Logic, Canvas, and a Member Portal. less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
I would love to speak with you further about this project, and appreciate the time and effort put into the requirements spec sheet you provided. After review, I would strongly advise you use your available budget to migrate away from wordpress. I understand this can be a sticking point for many, so I am not sending a full proposal at this time, but would love to hear from you if you are open to discussing your options.
I have worked with wordpress for over 10 years, and in the last 3 have worked tirelessly to move my clients (and others) away from the platform when appropriate. It is not secure, requires constant maintenance and updates to keep it moving fast enough for an ever-increasing majority of mobile users, and the plugin ecosystem is rife with messy, incomplete code bases. While it remains one of the most popular options, for individuals or businesses within a certain spending range, wordpress ends up being a black hole for technology budgets, with return on investment based highly on circumstantial or unproven dependancies. 
The primary alternative for any client within a $5-25k budget range is Craft CMS (https://craftcms.com/). It is stable, fast, highly extensible, has true first party support as well as strong community activity. 
I have personally used this CMS to build sites from non-profit and charity organizations to single page artist sites that managed hundreds of thousands of views per day. Its commerce component is also fully realized and much more stable and secure than any wordpress alternative. 

You can see a few sites I have built similar to your project scale recently here:
https://ibaboston.org/ 
http://thestrausslawfirm.com/
http://hamiltoncaptivemanagement.com/
https://www.supplyit.com/ 

If this is something your team would consider, please reach out. I would love to jump on a call and discuss in more detail your project and its specifications, and how I can help you exceed your goals with this project. Once we have had a chance to review and see if this is a viable direction for you, I will be happy to update this proposal with details specific to how we will be addressing each one of your sites requirements.

Hope to hear from you!
Thanks,
-Aaron

tl;dr - Seeking experienced web developer for ongoing consultation and some development work related to a new healthcare business. Key expertise: Wordpress, React, PageSpeed optimization, CDN & hosting config & optimization. Nice to have: SEO expertise

We recently acquired a site in the women's health space and are in the process of overhauling it to improve the aesthetics, user experience, and functionality of the site. We are onboarding a designer and a content director to handle design and content things associated with this project. With this job posting, we are looking to round out the team by finding an experienced web developer who we can call on for questions, consultations, and technical implementations that are beyond our capabilities. Think of it as an hourly CTO type thing. 

The role will primarily consist of three types of work: 

1) Tech consultation & planning - We know the importance of making technically sound decisions and plans. We also know we don’t have enough in-house technical muscle to see around all the corners we’d like to. We want to have an expert we can loop-in when necessary to improve our planning and technical decision making. 

2) Solve hard (for our team) technical problems - Inevitably, we will want our tech stack to do cool new things, some of which will be beyond our ability to implement. That’s where you come in ;) 

3) Grow with us - We’re excited about the early prospects of this venture. As it grows, so will our technical needs and we’d love to source as much of that work as possible to someone we already know and trust. 

About our site: currently built in Wordpress and hosted at Digital Ocean. 

About us: Combined 10+ yrs working directly with engineers in large and small tech companies. less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
Hello! I am very interested in hearing more about your needs, having worked as a fractional/de facto CTO for most of my professional career. I thoroughly enjoy working with startups, at all levels of business, and have experience implementing any number of technology solutions based on the emerging needs of the client. 
Hope to hear from you!
-Aaron

qa_section.question: Where / how can we see some of your work product?
qa_section.answer:
You can check out my work online at any number of client sites, but I would draw your attention to a few that I worked as fractional CTO for some period of time:

https://www.yogatoday.com/ - I worked with yogatoday for almost 5 years, after being brought on to assist with migrating from a platform that had been abandoned by the original developers and could no longer support their growing customer base. I advised on customer retention and acquisition through on site design and development updates, as well as integration with marketing tools including email drip campaigns and promotional features.

https://www.altpress.com/ - Another client that I rebuilt using a new CMS, with a focus on a new feature the client wanted at the time, artist profiles. This involved heavy lifting on the SEO side, as well as technical retooling to ensure that the system did not require consistent maintenance as the database grew.

https://www.realplay.us/ - A fledging startup when I was brought on, this client did not have any technical assets except for a wordpress site they had built themself and a facebook profile. I assisted in building their technology stack that would act as a jumping off point for pitching to investors. Additionally I designed their logo, as well as most design assets included in their pitch deck. Also designed physical assets (billboard, tv stand, table dressing, posters) for events in 2019-2020

https://brobible.com/ - A startup founded by a group of college graduates, I worked with brobible from one year after its inception until their sale to woven media group for greater than $3mil. I was personally responsible for design, development, and maintenance over the course of 4 years, taking a college age blog to a premier destination for one of the most coveted marketing demographics. I advised on advertising runs, events, and user engagement on the site leading to the eventual fundraise round and sale of the property.

https://betches.com/ - Similar to BroBible.com I was singularly responsible for design and development from a small blog run by 2 people into a massive undertaking including multiple office locations, two books, and 20 employees in 2 short years. less

qa_section.question: Please describe your comfort level and experience with modern web development technologies.
qa_section.answer: Extremely comfortable. I have enough experience and hands on knowledge to competently navigate new technologies, coupled with humility enough to switch gears and admit when things need to change. A constant trait for many developers is adherence to tools and routines despite the lack of fit, base solely on level of comfort. I try to stay mindful of this when making recommendations, and when investing my time in learning new technologies. less

qa_section.question: Do you have experience working with both hosted CMS (square space, wordpress) and headless CMS?
qa_section.answer: Yes, in the past two years I have turned to https://craftcms.com/ which can operate as a headless CMS. The interface and speed for development is beyond compare, and I have had a lot of success working with it. I would love the opportunity to discuss further!

title: Need to Create Simple Log In Form
job_description:
We need a front-end or full-stack dev to help create a login form that will be embedded on a static html file. The site is hosted on Duda which generates static html files once the site is published. This is similar to Webflow.

Preferably, we want this all done with Javascript, html, css. No PHP. 

You must build a simple login form. 
Form will accept username(email) and password. 
When user clicks login, we authenticate with API endpoint. 
Based on the response from API, we redirect user to correct place. 
The form will be embedded on a website that is separate from the API. The API is part of a web application that is hosted somewhere else. 

Need this one done today. less
More/Less about

title: Web Designer for digital health and wellness company - potential full-time opportunity
job_description:
We are a dynamic health and wellness company that focuses positioning our brand as the Food as Medicine movement. Our company culture thrives on team-work and mutual inspiration to see our clients live their best lives. Our managers are passionate about providing a solid on-boarding experience, communication, and providing employees with what they need to thrive, since the happiest employees are the most productive. Care is a cornerstone of our brand.

We are looking for a potential long-term WordPress Expert who can eventually take ownership over our web presence as a leader in the space. 

Immediately, we need an Elementor & Shopify Pro to seamlessly migrate our Woo Commerce to Shopify, and be available for 20 hours of work. 

Bonus if located in North Carolina with the willingness for in-person meetings in Raleigh to get in sync, though our team is primarily remote. 

We would love to make this a full-time opportunity provided quality and effectiveness of project completion is excellent. 

In your proposal, please include how the food as medicine movement touches you personally. less
More/Less about
cover_letter:
Hello!
Recently I have decided to make a very big change. Taking advantage of the housing market in NY, I put my house up for sale, bought an RV, and am now traveling the country while working remotely. Part of this new phase of my life includes making sure I eat healthy, organic food, with a focus on metabolic health in order to loser weight and have more energy. While the term "food as medicine" is somewhat new to me, I can easily apply the idea the mindset I have already adopted, trying to lower my intake of prescription & OTC medicines, and live a healthier lifestyle overall through exercise and food I have cooked and prepared myself. My travels so far have brought me to Myrtle Beach, SC and will be traveling back through North Carolina on the way to Tennessee towards the end of the month and would love to swing through Raleigh for a meeting if we are a good fit.

So more about my actual work experience: having 10+ years in senior positions across multiple verticals. qa_section.question: What past project or job have you had that is most like this one and why?
qa_section.answer: I have worked with a number of health related products that are still protected by NDA, but the one that stands out in my mind would be yogatoday.com. I worked with their company for almost 5 years, first moving their platform out of a system that had been abandoned by developers, and could not be updated or migrated without significant expense. We moved them to a system that endured for the following 7 years, even after I moved on to other projects. Also, the note about north carolina stood out, as I have never been before this last week. Seemed like a happy coincidence!
Hope to hear from you! less
